articles.title: Tankers diverted from Asia to Europe as gas prices keep rising - live updates - The Telegraph
articles.description: More cargo ships laden with natural gas are being diverted away from China to Europe as traders look to cash in on an unprecedented surge in prices.

articles.title: What to know about the Kazakhstan fuel protests - The Washington Post
articles.description: Demonstrations in the authoritarian Central Asian country are rare and represent a greater discontent with de facto leader-for-life Nursultan Nazarbayev.
articles.content: On Wednesday, as protests raged for a fourth day, President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said he had replaced Nazarbayev as head of the countrys powerful National Security Council. Earlier, Tokayev dismisse… [+975 chars]

articles.title: Goodbye BlackBerry, you were more than just a phone - Lifestyle Asia
articles.description: It’s the end of an era as BlackBerry decides to end service on its once predominant mobile phones from January 4. Here's what we'll miss.
articles.content: The year is 2012. My sisters boyfriend has got a job in London. And her first reaction is, wow, youll get a BlackBerry Torch for me now. BlackBerries were a huge fad back in the day. Everyone wanted … [+4702 chars]

articles.author: Malay Mail
articles.title: Siti Nur Alia first Malaysian woman to join world acclaimed Spain-based cycling team - Malay Mail
articles.description: KUALA TERENGGANU, Jan 4 — Terengganu cyclist Siti Nur Alia Mansor has become the first South-east Asian woman to join a professional world acclaimed cycling team, after she signed on as a rider for Spain-based Canyon-SRAM Racing Team. The 21-year-old will now…
articles.content:
The 21-year-old will now be the first and only national woman cyclist to compete in the UCI Womens World Tour. Bernama pic
